column4: You can specify a command (including a script) to run when an iPod is plugged in with System>Preferences>Removable Drives And Media I think
can more than one script be attached to a gnome-volume-manager event?
Probably not, but a script can do more than one thing :)
the thing is, I have both a psp and an ipod and they are both detected as music devices!
I was wondering if I could make it only for the ipod?

You could make a script which checks "ls /media/whatever/ | grep -c "file"" then it will give a 1 if a certain file is detected and zero if not. Give it an iPod specific file and you can now tell the difference :)
